forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 43. North wind 17 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 8am, then a chance of rain showers. Cloudy, with a high near 56. West wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The night drapes over Boston like a thick woolen blanket, heavy with the promise of rain that taps insistently on roofs and pavements. As we sit in the quiet hours before dawn, the temperature hovers uncomfortably cool, suggesting that a sturdy jacket or perhaps a weather-resistant coat is advisable. The north wind carries a sharp bite, beckoning one to seek refuge indoors, while the frequent gusts remind us that something far more tempestuous lurks outside.

As the morning breaks, the forecast hints at a subdued day ahead: an early brush with rain that may taper into sporadic showers. Yet, with a high near 56, it offers a glimmer of mildness beneath a perpetually overcast sky. Those venturing out might find solace in well-constructed shoes, perfect for dodging puddles. With the clouds casting a veil over the cityscape, the ambiance feels ripe for quiet contemplation. Perhaps now is a time to linger in cafes, sipping on hot beverages while watching the world shift outside, too damp for the usual hustle yet teeming with the soft murmurs of life. The rainy whispers of the day invite us to embrace the cozy, reflective moments—each drop a reminder that even in gloom, there is beauty to be discovered.
